results.title: Picture start
results.brief_description: Making a film is only half the battle. Screening it is the other half, especially when there is a resistance from an unexpected quarter, eighth, sixteenth. The result is an amusing struggle with a particularly mischievous film leader. This engaging piece of genuine animation blends both computer generated and cell drawn material.

results.title: Picture palaces
results.brief_description:
Black and white photos of movie houses from Melbourne’s recent past including the State Theatre, Capitol, Regent and Hoyts.

Part One of the project(delivered 3 Sept 2001): documentation of the photographic archive and reproduction onto digital beta.

Palaces in order of appearance:
1. Melba Theatre
2. Liberty Theatre
3. Odeon Theatre
4. Regent Theatre
5. Plaza Theatre
6. Hoyts De Lux - Bourke Street
7. Lyceum Theatre - Bourke Street
8. Capitol Theatre
9. Kings Theatre
10. Savoy Theatre
11. Palace Theatre
12. St James Theatre
13. Metro Theatre - Bourke Street
14. Grosvenor Theatre
15. Athanaeum Theatre
16. The Auditorium Theatre - Collins
17. Metro Theatre - Collins Stree circa 1941
18. Majestic Theatre
19. State Theatre
20. Forum Theatre

results.title: Picture music
results.brief_description: Presents a compilation of 20 contemporary rock-video clips. Includes such artists as Kim Carnes, Thomas Dolby, Kim Wilde, The Vapors, Hazel O’Connor Bow Wow Wow, Depeche Mode, The Tubes, Duran Duran and Kate Bush. Each video clip has its own director, no overall director or producer.

results.title: Picture in your mind
results.creator_credit: Philip Stapp, Julien Bryan, McGraw-Hill Films and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Philip Stapp’s sequel to “Boundary Lines” (001397), with a special score by Gene Forell. This film shows the background and growth of prejudice, from the dawn of mankind. It indicates the responsibility of the individual for a better world. Animated, inventive and evocative. Spoken by Walter Abel.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip Stapp, Julien Bryan, McGraw-Hill Films and International Film Foundation

results.title: Picture Framing for Beginners
results.brief_description: A comprehensive guide to picture framing and mounting showing every step for successful framing. Using inexpensive equipment, the hobby can also become a profitable sideline. There are sections on the tools required, measuring (in inches) framing dimensions, cutting and joining mitres, selecting the mount material, cutting the mount and the glass, selecting the frame material, framing and securing the picture, and positioning the hooks.

results.title: Picture Canada = Images du Canada
results.creator_credit: Bruno Rubeo, Nous Auties, All About Us and GBR
results.brief_description: Animated film showing a child’s view of the Canadian landscape through children’s paintings. There is no dialogue, only background music and sound effects.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruno Rubeo, Nous Auties, All About Us and GBR

results.title: Picture Canada
results.creator_credit: Jim Turpie, Kodak Canada Inc. and Crawley Films
results.brief_description: The work of fifteen photographers went into the filming of this memorable picture of Canada - vivid coast to coast impressions of the Canadian mosaic, the diversity of scene, life and culture with historical re-enactments. Fast-paced and entertaining using innovative cinematography and early 70’s music soundtrack.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Turpie, Kodak Canada Inc. and Crawley Films

results.title: Picture books on video. - Volume 3 = The gigantic balloon
results.creator_credit: Catharine Campbell, Cathy Miller and Video Classroom
results.brief_description: The award winning, Australian children’s stories on this video include “The Gigantic Balloon” by Ruth Park with illustrations by Kilmeny and Deborah Niland and narration by Robert Coleby, “The Tram to Bondi Beach” by Elizabeth Hathorn with illustrations by Julie Vivas and narration by Robert Coleby, and “My Grandmother Lived in Gooligulch” written and illustrated by Graeme Base with narration by Tim McKenzie.

results.title: Picture books on video. - Volume 2 = Turramulli and the giant Quinkin
results.creator_credit: Cathy Miller, Catharine Campbell and Video Classroom
results.brief_description: Three Aboriginal Dreamtime stories. “Turramulli the giant Quinkin” and “Banana Bird and the Snake men” are both written by Percy Trezise, illustrated by Dick Roughsey and narrated by Bob Maza. “The Frog and the pelican” is written by Des O’Brien. The stories are narrated with background music as the illustrations are shown on screen.
